SpeechGrammarList.summary: NOTE Experimental The SpeechGrammarList interface of the Web Speech API represents a list of objects containing words or patterns of words that we want the recognition service to recognize.

remarks.para: Grammar is defined using JSpeech Grammar Format (JSGF.) Other formats may also be supported in the future.

SpeechGrammarListAddFromString.summary:
NOTE Experimental The addFromString() method of the
interface takes a grammar present in a specific
string within the code base (e.g., stored in a variable) and adds it to
the SpeechGrammarList as a new object.

SpeechGrammarListAddFromURI.summary:
NOTE Experimental The addFromURI() method of the
interface takes a grammar present at a specific URI and
adds it to the SpeechGrammarList as a new
object.

remarks.para:
Note that some speech recognition services may support built-in grammars that can be
specified by URI.

SpeechGrammarListItem.summary:
NOTE Experimental The item getter of the
interface is a standard getter â€” it allows individual
objects to be retrieved from the SpeechGrammarList using array syntax.

SpeechGrammarListLength.summary:
NOTE Experimental The length read-only property of the
interface returns the number of
objects contained in the .
SpeechGrammarListLength.value:
A number indicating the number of objects contained in the
.

SpeechGrammarListSpeechGrammarList.summary:
NOTE Experimental The SpeechGrammarList() constructor creates a new
SpeechGrammarList object instance.
